intro: Andryala webbii, commonly known as the narrow-leaved andryala, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with slender stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its small, white flowers appear in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family, and it blooms during the cooler months. Andryala webbii is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand arid conditions.
